Specific Details: Mr O’Dea was asked to support Senator Paul Gavan’s Bill to give workers a legal right to their tips. The Bill entitled National Minimum Wage (Protection of Employee Tips) Bill 2017: Came to Committee Stage on the 20th February 2019, and it successfully passed Committee stage with all-party support.
Subject Matter: Mr O’Dea was asked to support Senator Paul Gavan’s Bill to give workers a legal right to their tips. The Bill entitled National Minimum Wage (Protection of Employee Tips) Bill 2017: Came to Committee Stage on the 20th February 2019, and it successfully passed Committee stage with all-party support.
Intended Results: To secure Mr O'Dea to support Senator Paul Gavan’s Bill to give workers a legal right to their tips. The Bill entitled National Minimum Wage (Protection of Employee Tips) Bill 2017
Lobbying Activities: A phone call on Monday 18th February 2019 to Mr Willie O'Dea.|Phone call|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Mike McNamara, Fórsa Assistant General Secretary, Mid-West Region Health & Local Government; President of the Limerick Council of Trade Unions
Grassroots directive: Yes – The Campaign included efforts from ICTU, SIPTU, Mandate, Unite and the USI, along with support from the One Galway and the One Cork projects and from Limerick Council of Trades Union Groups, and community activist groups.Mr O'Dea was contacted in my capacity as Presdient of the Limerick Council of Trade Unions, a position held as a Fórsa member within the umbrella group of the trade unions in Limerick.The outcome was that Mr O'Dea reported back that he had confirmation tht the Fianna Fail front bench would support the Bill, and furthermore they had advised the minister that they were supporting the Bill and that if it went to a vote the Government would be defeated.
